00037 /*
00038  *  linux/drivers/block/loop.c
00039  *
00040  *  Written by Theodore Ts'o, 3/29/93
00041  *
00042  * Copyright 1993 by Theodore Ts'o.  Redistribution of this file is
00043  * permitted under the GNU General Public License.
00044  *
00045  * Modularized and updated for 1.1.16 kernel - Mitch Dsouza 28th May 1994
00046  * Adapted for 1.3.59 kernel - Andries Brouwer, 1 Feb 1996
00047  *
00048  * Fixed do_loop_request() re-entrancy - Vincent.Renardias@waw.com Mar 20, 1997
00049  *
00050  * Added devfs support - Richard Gooch <rgooch@atnf.csiro.au> 16-Jan-1998
00051  *
00052  * Handle sparse backing files correctly - Kenn Humborg, Jun 28, 1998
00053  *
00054  * Loadable modules and other fixes by AK, 1998
00055  *
00056  * Maximum number of loop devices now dynamic via max_loop module parameter.
00057  * Russell Kroll <rkroll@exploits.org> 19990701
00058  *
00059  * Maximum number of loop devices when compiled-in now selectable by passing
00060  * max_loop=<1-255> to the kernel on boot.
00061  * Erik I. Bols?, <eriki@himolde.no>, Oct 31, 1999
00062  *
00063  * Completely rewrite request handling to be make_request_fn style and
00064  * non blocking, pushing work to a helper thread. Lots of fixes from
00065  * Al Viro too.
00066  * Jens Axboe <axboe@suse.de>, Nov 2000
00067  *
00068  * Support up to 256 loop devices
00069  * Heinz Mauelshagen <mge@sistina.com>, Feb 2002
00070  *
00071  * Support for falling back on the write file operation when the address space
00072  * operations prepare_write and/or commit_write are not available on the
00073  * backing filesystem.
00074  * Anton Altaparmakov, 16 Feb 2005
00075  *
00076  * Still To Fix:
00077  * - Advisory locking is ignored here.
00078  * - Should use an own CAP_* category instead of CAP_SYS_ADMIN
00079  *
00080  */

00111 #define LLOOP_MAX_SEGMENTS        LNET_MAX_IOV
00112 
00113 /* Possible states of device */
00114 enum {
00115         LLOOP_UNBOUND,
00116         LLOOP_BOUND,
00117         LLOOP_RUNDOWN,
00118 };
00119 
00120 struct lloop_device {
00121         int                  lo_number;
00122         int                  lo_refcnt;
00123         loff_t               lo_offset;
00124         loff_t               lo_sizelimit;
00125         int                  lo_flags;
00126         struct file         *lo_backing_file;
00127         struct block_device *lo_device;
00128         unsigned             lo_blocksize;
00129 
00130         gfp_t                   old_gfp_mask;
00131 
00132         spinlock_t              lo_lock;
00133         struct bio              *lo_bio;
00134         struct bio              *lo_biotail;
00135         int                     lo_state;
00136         struct semaphore        lo_sem;
00137         struct mutex            lo_ctl_mutex;
00138         atomic_t                lo_pending;
00139         wait_queue_head_t       lo_bh_wait;
00140 
00141         struct request_queue *lo_queue;
00142 
00143         const struct lu_env *lo_env;
00144         struct cl_io         lo_io;
00145         struct ll_dio_pages  lo_pvec;
00146 
00147         /* data to handle bio for lustre. */
00148         struct lo_request_data {
00149                 struct page *lrd_pages[LLOOP_MAX_SEGMENTS];
00150                 loff_t       lrd_offsets[LLOOP_MAX_SEGMENTS];
00151         } lo_requests[1];
00152 };

00155  * Loop flags

00157 enum {
00158         LO_FLAGS_READ_ONLY       = 1,
00159 };

00161 static int lloop_major;
00162 #define MAX_LOOP_DEFAULT  16
00163 static int max_loop = MAX_LOOP_DEFAULT;

00167 static void *ll_iocontrol_magic = NULL;
00168 
00169 static loff_t get_loop_size(struct lloop_device *lo, struct file *file)
00170 {
00171         loff_t size, offset, loopsize;
00172 
00173         /* Compute loopsize in bytes */
00174         size = i_size_read(file->f_mapping->host);
00175         offset = lo->lo_offset;
00176         loopsize = size - offset;
00177         if (lo->lo_sizelimit > 0 && lo->lo_sizelimit < loopsize)
00178                 loopsize = lo->lo_sizelimit;
00179 
00180         /*
00181          * Unfortunately, if we want to do I/O on the device,
00182          * the number of 512-byte sectors has to fit into a sector_t.
00183          */
00184         return loopsize >> 9;
00185 }
00186 
00187 static int do_bio_lustrebacked(struct lloop_device *lo, struct bio *head)
00188 {
00189         const struct lu_env  *env   = lo->lo_env;
00190         struct cl_io         *io    = &lo->lo_io;
00191         struct dentry        *de    = lo->lo_backing_file->f_path.dentry;
00192         struct inode         *inode = de->d_inode;
00193         struct cl_object     *obj = ll_i2info(inode)->lli_clob;
00194         pgoff_t               offset;
00195         int                   ret;
00196 #ifdef HAVE_BVEC_ITER
00197         struct bvec_iter      iter;
00198         struct bio_vec        bvec;
00199 #else
00200         int                   iter;
00201         struct bio_vec       *bvec;
00202 #endif
00203         int                   rw;
00204         size_t                page_count = 0;
00205         struct bio           *bio;
00206         ssize_t               bytes;
00207 
00208         struct ll_dio_pages  *pvec = &lo->lo_pvec;
00209         struct page         **pages = pvec->ldp_pages;
00210         loff_t               *offsets = pvec->ldp_offsets;
00211 
00212         truncate_inode_pages(inode->i_mapping, 0);
00213 
00214         /* initialize the IO */
00215         memset(io, 0, sizeof(*io));
00216         io->ci_obj = obj;
00217         ret = cl_io_init(env, io, CIT_MISC, obj);
00218         if (ret)
00219                 return io->ci_result;
00220         io->ci_lockreq = CILR_NEVER;
00221 
00222         LASSERT(head != NULL);
00223         rw = head->bi_rw;
00224         for (bio = head; bio != NULL; bio = bio->bi_next) {
00225                 LASSERT(rw == bio->bi_rw);
00226 
00227 #ifdef HAVE_BVEC_ITER
00228                 offset = (pgoff_t)(bio->bi_iter.bi_sector << 9) + lo->lo_offset;
00229                 bio_for_each_segment(bvec, bio, iter) {
00230                         BUG_ON(bvec.bv_offset != 0);
00231                         BUG_ON(bvec.bv_len != PAGE_CACHE_SIZE);
00232 
00233                         pages[page_count] = bvec.bv_page;
00234                         offsets[page_count] = offset;
00235                         page_count++;
00236                         offset += bvec.bv_len;
00237 #else
00238                 offset = (pgoff_t)(bio->bi_sector << 9) + lo->lo_offset;
00239                 bio_for_each_segment(bvec, bio, iter) {
00240                         BUG_ON(bvec->bv_offset != 0);
00241                         BUG_ON(bvec->bv_len != PAGE_CACHE_SIZE);
00242 
00243                         pages[page_count] = bvec->bv_page;
00244                         offsets[page_count] = offset;
00245                         page_count++;
00246                         offset += bvec->bv_len;
00247 #endif
00248                 }
00249                 LASSERT(page_count <= LLOOP_MAX_SEGMENTS);
00250         }
00251 
00252         ll_stats_ops_tally(ll_i2sbi(inode),
00253                         (rw == WRITE) ? LPROC_LL_BRW_WRITE : LPROC_LL_BRW_READ,
00254                         page_count);
00255 
00256         pvec->ldp_size = page_count << PAGE_CACHE_SHIFT;
00257         pvec->ldp_nr = page_count;
00258 
00259         /* FIXME: in ll_direct_rw_pages, it has to allocate many cl_page{}s to
00260          * write those pages into OST. Even worse case is that more pages
00261          * would be asked to write out to swap space, and then finally get here
00262          * again.
00263          * Unfortunately this is NOT easy to fix.
00264          * Thoughts on solution:
00265          * 0. Define a reserved pool for cl_pages, which could be a list of
00266          *    pre-allocated cl_pages;
00267          * 1. Define a new operation in cl_object_operations{}, says clo_depth,
00268          *    which measures how many layers for this lustre object. Generally
00269          *    speaking, the depth would be 2, one for llite, and one for lovsub.
00270          *    However, for SNS, there will be more since we need additional page
00271          *    to store parity;
00272          * 2. Reserve the # of (page_count * depth) cl_pages from the reserved
00273          *    pool. Afterwards, the clio would allocate the pages from reserved
00274          *    pool, this guarantees we neeedn't allocate the cl_pages from
00275          *    generic cl_page slab cache.
00276          *    Of course, if there is NOT enough pages in the pool, we might
00277          *    be asked to write less pages once, this purely depends on
00278          *    implementation. Anyway, we should be careful to avoid deadlocking.
00279          */
00280         mutex_lock(&inode->i_mutex);
00281         bytes = ll_direct_rw_pages(env, io, rw, inode, pvec);
00282         mutex_unlock(&inode->i_mutex);
00283         cl_io_fini(env, io);
00284         return (bytes == pvec->ldp_size) ? 0 : (int)bytes;
00285 }
00286 
00287 /*
00288  * Add bio to back of pending list
00289  */
00290 static void loop_add_bio(struct lloop_device *lo, struct bio *bio)
00291 {
00292         unsigned long flags;
00293 
00294         spin_lock_irqsave(&lo->lo_lock, flags);
00295         if (lo->lo_biotail) {
00296                 lo->lo_biotail->bi_next = bio;
00297                 lo->lo_biotail = bio;
00298         } else
00299                 lo->lo_bio = lo->lo_biotail = bio;
00300         spin_unlock_irqrestore(&lo->lo_lock, flags);
00301 
00302         atomic_inc(&lo->lo_pending);
00303         if (waitqueue_active(&lo->lo_bh_wait))
00304                 wake_up(&lo->lo_bh_wait);
00305 }
00306 
00307 /*
00308  * Grab first pending buffer
00309  */
00310 static unsigned int loop_get_bio(struct lloop_device *lo, struct bio **req)
00311 {
00312         struct bio *first;
00313         struct bio **bio;
00314         unsigned int count = 0;
00315         unsigned int page_count = 0;
00316         int rw;
00317 
00318         spin_lock_irq(&lo->lo_lock);
00319         first = lo->lo_bio;
00320         if (unlikely(first == NULL)) {
00321                 spin_unlock_irq(&lo->lo_lock);
00322                 return 0;
00323         }
00324 
00325         /* TODO: need to split the bio, too bad. */
00326         LASSERT(first->bi_vcnt <= LLOOP_MAX_SEGMENTS);
00327 
00328         rw = first->bi_rw;
00329         bio = &lo->lo_bio;
00330         while (*bio && (*bio)->bi_rw == rw) {
00331 #ifdef HAVE_BVEC_ITER
00332                 CDEBUG(D_INFO, "bio sector %llu size %u count %u vcnt%u \n",
00333                        (unsigned long long)(*bio)->bi_iter.bi_sector,
00334                        (*bio)->bi_iter.bi_size, page_count, (*bio)->bi_vcnt);
00335 #else
00336                 CDEBUG(D_INFO, "bio sector %llu size %u count %u vcnt%u \n",
00337                        (unsigned long long)(*bio)->bi_sector, (*bio)->bi_size,
00338                        page_count, (*bio)->bi_vcnt);
00339 #endif
00340                 if (page_count + (*bio)->bi_vcnt > LLOOP_MAX_SEGMENTS)
00341                         break;
00342 
00343                 page_count += (*bio)->bi_vcnt;
00344                 count++;
00345                 bio = &(*bio)->bi_next;
00346         }
00347         if (*bio) {
00348                 /* Some of bios can't be mergable. */
00349                 lo->lo_bio = *bio;
00350                 *bio = NULL;
00351         } else {
00352                 /* Hit the end of queue */
00353                 lo->lo_biotail = NULL;
00354                 lo->lo_bio = NULL;
00355         }
00356         *req = first;
00357         spin_unlock_irq(&lo->lo_lock);
00358         return count;
00359 }
00360 
00361 static ll_mrf_ret
00362 loop_make_request(struct request_queue *q, struct bio *old_bio)
00363 {
00364         struct lloop_device *lo = q->queuedata;
00365         int rw = bio_rw(old_bio);
00366         int inactive;
00367 
00368         if (!lo)
00369                 goto err;
00370 
00371 #ifdef HAVE_BVEC_ITER
00372         CDEBUG(D_INFO, "submit bio sector %llu size %u\n",
00373                (unsigned long long)old_bio->bi_iter.bi_sector,
00374                old_bio->bi_iter.bi_size);
00375 #else
00376         CDEBUG(D_INFO, "submit bio sector %llu size %u\n",
00377                (unsigned long long)old_bio->bi_sector, old_bio->bi_size);
00378 #endif
00379 
00380         spin_lock_irq(&lo->lo_lock);
00381         inactive = (lo->lo_state != LLOOP_BOUND);
00382         spin_unlock_irq(&lo->lo_lock);
00383         if (inactive)
00384                 goto err;
00385 
00386         if (rw == WRITE) {
00387                 if (lo->lo_flags & LO_FLAGS_READ_ONLY)
00388                         goto err;
00389         } else if (rw == READA) {
00390                 rw = READ;
00391         } else if (rw != READ) {
00392                 CERROR("lloop: unknown command (%x)\n", rw);
00393                 goto err;
00394         }
00395         loop_add_bio(lo, old_bio);
00396         LL_MRF_RETURN(0);
00397 err:
00398         bio_io_error(old_bio);
00399         LL_MRF_RETURN(0);
00400 }
00401 
00402 #ifdef HAVE_REQUEST_QUEUE_UNPLUG_FN
00403 /*
00404  * kick off io on the underlying address space
00405  */
00406 static void loop_unplug(struct request_queue *q)
00407 {
00408         struct lloop_device *lo = q->queuedata;
00409 
00410         clear_bit(QUEUE_FLAG_PLUGGED, &q->queue_flags);
00411         blk_run_address_space(lo->lo_backing_file->f_mapping);
00412 }
00413 #endif
00414 
00415 static inline void loop_handle_bio(struct lloop_device *lo, struct bio *bio)
00416 {
00417         int ret;
00418 
00419         ret  = do_bio_lustrebacked(lo, bio);
00420         while (bio) {
00421                 struct bio *tmp = bio->bi_next;
00422 
00423                 bio->bi_next = NULL;
00424 #ifdef HAVE_BIO_ENDIO_USES_ONE_ARG
00425                 bio->bi_error = ret;
00426                 bio_endio(bio);
00427 #else
00428                 bio_endio(bio, ret);
00429 #endif
00430                 bio = tmp;
00431         }
00432 }
00433 
00434 static inline int loop_active(struct lloop_device *lo)
00435 {
00436         return atomic_read(&lo->lo_pending) ||
00437                (lo->lo_state == LLOOP_RUNDOWN);
00438 }
00439 
00440 /*
00441  * worker thread that handles reads/writes to file backed loop devices,
00442  * to avoid blocking in our make_request_fn.
00443  */
00444 static int loop_thread(void *data)
00445 {
00446         struct lloop_device *lo = data;
00447         struct bio *bio;
00448         unsigned int count;
00449         unsigned long times = 0;
00450         unsigned long total_count = 0;
00451 
00452         struct lu_env *env;
00453         __u16 refcheck;
00454         int ret = 0;
00455 
00456         set_user_nice(current, -20);
00457 
00458         lo->lo_state = LLOOP_BOUND;
00459 
00460         env = cl_env_get(&refcheck);
00461         if (IS_ERR(env))
00462                 GOTO(out, ret = PTR_ERR(env));
00463 
00464         lo->lo_env = env;
00465         memset(&lo->lo_pvec, 0, sizeof(lo->lo_pvec));
00466         lo->lo_pvec.ldp_pages   = lo->lo_requests[0].lrd_pages;
00467         lo->lo_pvec.ldp_offsets = lo->lo_requests[0].lrd_offsets;
00468 
00469         /*
00470          * up sem, we are running
00471          */
00472         up(&lo->lo_sem);
00473 
00474         for (;;) {
00475                 wait_event(lo->lo_bh_wait, loop_active(lo));
00476                 if (!atomic_read(&lo->lo_pending)) {
00477                         int exiting = 0;
00478                         spin_lock_irq(&lo->lo_lock);
00479                         exiting = (lo->lo_state == LLOOP_RUNDOWN);
00480                         spin_unlock_irq(&lo->lo_lock);
00481                         if (exiting)
00482                                 break;
00483                 }
00484 
00485                 bio = NULL;
00486                 count = loop_get_bio(lo, &bio);
00487                 if (!count) {
00488                         CWARN("lloop(minor: %d): missing bio\n", lo->lo_number);
00489                         continue;
00490                 }
00491 
00492                 total_count += count;
00493                 if (total_count < count) {     /* overflow */
00494                         total_count = count;
00495                         times = 1;
00496                 } else {
00497                         times++;
00498                 }
00499                 if ((times & 127) == 0) {
00500                         CDEBUG(D_INFO, "total: %lu, count: %lu, avg: %lu\n",
00501                                total_count, times, total_count / times);
00502                 }
00503 
00504                 LASSERT(bio != NULL);
00505                 LASSERT(count <= atomic_read(&lo->lo_pending));
00506                 loop_handle_bio(lo, bio);
00507                 atomic_sub(count, &lo->lo_pending);
00508         }
00509         cl_env_put(env, &refcheck);
00510 
00511 out:
00512         up(&lo->lo_sem);
00513         return ret;
00514 }
00515 
00516 static int loop_set_fd(struct lloop_device *lo, struct file *unused,
00517                        struct block_device *bdev, struct file *file)
00518 {
00519         struct inode         *inode;
00520         struct address_space *mapping;
00521         int                   lo_flags = 0;
00522         int                   error;
00523         loff_t                size;
00524 
00525         if (!try_module_get(THIS_MODULE))
00526                 return -ENODEV;
00527 
00528         error = -EBUSY;
00529         if (lo->lo_state != LLOOP_UNBOUND)
00530                 goto out;
00531 
00532         mapping = file->f_mapping;
00533         inode = mapping->host;
00534 
00535         error = -EINVAL;
00536         if (!S_ISREG(inode->i_mode) || inode->i_sb->s_magic != LL_SUPER_MAGIC)
00537                 goto out;
00538 
00539         if (!(file->f_mode & FMODE_WRITE))
00540                 lo_flags |= LO_FLAGS_READ_ONLY;
00541 
00542         size = get_loop_size(lo, file);
00543 
00544         if ((loff_t)(sector_t)size != size) {
00545                 error = -EFBIG;
00546                 goto out;
00547         }
00548 
00549         /* remove all pages in cache so as dirty pages not to be existent. */
00550         truncate_inode_pages(mapping, 0);
00551 
00552         set_device_ro(bdev, (lo_flags & LO_FLAGS_READ_ONLY) != 0);
00553 
00554         lo->lo_blocksize = PAGE_CACHE_SIZE;
00555         lo->lo_device = bdev;
00556         lo->lo_flags = lo_flags;
00557         lo->lo_backing_file = file;
00558         lo->lo_sizelimit = 0;
00559         lo->old_gfp_mask = mapping_gfp_mask(mapping);
00560         mapping_set_gfp_mask(mapping, lo->old_gfp_mask & ~(__GFP_IO|__GFP_FS));
00561 
00562         lo->lo_bio = lo->lo_biotail = NULL;
00563 
00564         /*
00565          * set queue make_request_fn, and add limits based on lower level
00566          * device
00567          */
00568         blk_queue_make_request(lo->lo_queue, loop_make_request);
00569         lo->lo_queue->queuedata = lo;
00570 #ifdef HAVE_REQUEST_QUEUE_UNPLUG_FN
00571         lo->lo_queue->unplug_fn = loop_unplug;
00572 #endif
00573 
00574         /* queue parameters */
00575         blk_queue_max_hw_sectors(lo->lo_queue,
00576                                  LLOOP_MAX_SEGMENTS << (PAGE_CACHE_SHIFT - 9));
00577         blk_queue_max_segments(lo->lo_queue, LLOOP_MAX_SEGMENTS);
00578 
00579         set_capacity(disks[lo->lo_number], size);
00580         bd_set_size(bdev, size << 9);
00581 
00582         set_blocksize(bdev, lo->lo_blocksize);
00583 
00584         kthread_run(loop_thread, lo, "lloop%d", lo->lo_number);
00585         down(&lo->lo_sem);
00586         return 0;
00587 
00588 out:
00589         /* This is safe: open() is still holding a reference. */
00590         module_put(THIS_MODULE);
00591         return error;
00592 }
00593 
00594 static int loop_clr_fd(struct lloop_device *lo, struct block_device *bdev,
00595                        int count)
00596 {
00597         struct file *filp = lo->lo_backing_file;
00598         gfp_t gfp = lo->old_gfp_mask;
00599 
00600         if (lo->lo_state != LLOOP_BOUND)
00601                 return -ENXIO;
00602 
00603         if (lo->lo_refcnt > count)        /* we needed one fd for the ioctl */
00604                 return -EBUSY;
00605 
00606         if (filp == NULL)
00607                 return -EINVAL;
00608 
00609         spin_lock_irq(&lo->lo_lock);
00610         lo->lo_state = LLOOP_RUNDOWN;
00611         spin_unlock_irq(&lo->lo_lock);
00612         wake_up(&lo->lo_bh_wait);
00613 
00614         down(&lo->lo_sem);
00615         lo->lo_backing_file = NULL;
00616         lo->lo_device = NULL;
00617         lo->lo_offset = 0;
00618         lo->lo_sizelimit = 0;
00619         lo->lo_flags = 0;
00620         invalidate_bdev(bdev);
00621         set_capacity(disks[lo->lo_number], 0);
00622         bd_set_size(bdev, 0);
00623         mapping_set_gfp_mask(filp->f_mapping, gfp);
00624         lo->lo_state = LLOOP_UNBOUND;
00625         fput(filp);
00626         /* This is safe: open() is still holding a reference. */
00627         module_put(THIS_MODULE);
00628         return 0;
00629 }
00630 
00631 static int lo_open(struct block_device *bdev, fmode_t mode)
00632 {
00633         struct lloop_device *lo = bdev->bd_disk->private_data;
00634 
00635         mutex_lock(&lo->lo_ctl_mutex);
00636         lo->lo_refcnt++;
00637         mutex_unlock(&lo->lo_ctl_mutex);
00638 
00639         return 0;
00640 }
00641 
00642 #ifdef HAVE_BLKDEV_RELEASE_RETURN_INT
00643 static int
00644 #else
00645 static void
00646 #endif
00647 lo_release(struct gendisk *disk, fmode_t mode)
00648 {
00649         struct lloop_device *lo = disk->private_data;
00650 
00651         mutex_lock(&lo->lo_ctl_mutex);
00652         --lo->lo_refcnt;
00653         mutex_unlock(&lo->lo_ctl_mutex);
00654 #ifdef HAVE_BLKDEV_RELEASE_RETURN_INT
00655         return 0;
00656 #endif
00657 }
00658 
00659 /* lloop device node's ioctl function. */
00660 static int lo_ioctl(struct block_device *bdev, fmode_t mode,
00661                     unsigned int cmd, unsigned long arg)
00662 {
00663         struct lloop_device *lo = bdev->bd_disk->private_data;
00664         int err = 0;
00665 
00666         mutex_lock(&lloop_mutex);
00667         switch (cmd) {
00668         case LL_IOC_LLOOP_DETACH: {
00669                 err = loop_clr_fd(lo, bdev, 2);
00670                 if (err == 0)
00671                         blkdev_put(bdev, 0); /* grabbed in LLOOP_ATTACH */
00672                 break;
00673         }
00674 
00675         case LL_IOC_LLOOP_INFO: {
00676                 struct inode *inode;
00677                 struct lu_fid fid;
00678 
00679                 if (lo->lo_backing_file == NULL) {
00680                         err = -ENOENT;
00681                         break;
00682                 }
00683                 inode = lo->lo_backing_file->f_path.dentry->d_inode;
00684                 if (inode != NULL && lo->lo_state == LLOOP_BOUND)
00685                         fid = ll_i2info(inode)->lli_fid;
00686                 else
00687                         fid_zero(&fid);
00688 
00689                 if (copy_to_user((struct lu_fid __user *)arg,
00690                                  &fid, sizeof(fid)))
00691                         err = -EFAULT;
00692                 break;
00693         }
00694 
00695         default:
00696                 err = -EINVAL;
00697                 break;
00698         }
00699         mutex_unlock(&lloop_mutex);
00700 
00701         return err;
00702 }
00703 
00704 static struct block_device_operations lo_fops = {
00705         .owner =        THIS_MODULE,
00706         .open =         lo_open,
00707         .release =      lo_release,
00708         .ioctl =        lo_ioctl,
00709 };
00710 
00711 /* dynamic iocontrol callback.
00712  * This callback is registered in lloop_init and will be called by
00713  * ll_iocontrol_call.
00714  *
00715  * This is a llite regular file ioctl function. It takes the responsibility
00716  * of attaching or detaching a file by a lloop's device numner.
00717  */
00718 static enum llioc_iter lloop_ioctl(struct inode *unused, struct file *file,
00719                                    unsigned int cmd, unsigned long arg,
00720                                    void *magic, int *rcp)
00721 {
00722         struct lloop_device *lo = NULL;
00723         struct block_device *bdev = NULL;
00724         int err = 0;
00725         dev_t dev;
00726 
00727         if (magic != ll_iocontrol_magic)
00728                 return LLIOC_CONT;
00729 
00730         if (disks == NULL)
00731                 GOTO(out1, err = -ENODEV);
00732 
00733         CWARN("Enter llop_ioctl\n");
00734 
00735         mutex_lock(&lloop_mutex);
00736         switch (cmd) {
00737         case LL_IOC_LLOOP_ATTACH: {
00738                 struct inode *inode = file->f_path.dentry->d_inode;
00739                 struct lloop_device *lo_free = NULL;
00740                 int i;
00741 
00742                 for (i = 0; i < max_loop; i++, lo = NULL) {
00743                         lo = &loop_dev[i];
00744                         if (lo->lo_state == LLOOP_UNBOUND) {
00745                                 if (!lo_free)
00746                                         lo_free = lo;
00747                                 continue;
00748                         }
00749                         if (lo->lo_backing_file->f_path.dentry->d_inode ==
00750                             inode)
00751                                 break;
00752                 }
00753                 if (lo || !lo_free)
00754                         GOTO(out, err = -EBUSY);
00755 
00756                 lo = lo_free;
00757                 dev = MKDEV(lloop_major, lo->lo_number);
00758 
00759                 /* quit if the used pointer is writable */
00760                 if (put_user((long)old_encode_dev(dev), (long __user *)arg))
00761                         GOTO(out, err = -EFAULT);
00762 
00763                 bdev = blkdev_get_by_dev(dev, file->f_mode, NULL);
00764                 if (IS_ERR(bdev))
00765                         GOTO(out, err = PTR_ERR(bdev));
00766 
00767                 get_file(file);
00768                 err = loop_set_fd(lo, NULL, bdev, file);
00769                 if (err) {
00770                         fput(file);
00771                         blkdev_put(bdev, 0);
00772                 }
00773 
00774                 break;
00775         }
00776 
00777         case LL_IOC_LLOOP_DETACH_BYDEV: {
00778                 int minor;
00779 
00780                 dev = old_decode_dev(arg);
00781                 if (MAJOR(dev) != lloop_major)
00782                         GOTO(out, err = -EINVAL);
00783 
00784                 minor = MINOR(dev);
00785                 if (minor > max_loop - 1)
00786                         GOTO(out, err = -EINVAL);
00787 
00788                 lo = &loop_dev[minor];
00789                 if (lo->lo_state != LLOOP_BOUND)
00790                         GOTO(out, err = -EINVAL);
00791 
00792                 bdev = lo->lo_device;
00793                 err = loop_clr_fd(lo, bdev, 1);
00794                 if (err == 0)
00795                         blkdev_put(bdev, 0); /* grabbed in LLOOP_ATTACH */
00796 
00797                 break;
00798         }
00799 
00800         default:
00801                 err = -EINVAL;
00802                 break;
00803         }
00804 
00805 out:
00806         mutex_unlock(&lloop_mutex);
00807 out1:
00808         if (rcp)
00809                 *rcp = err;
00810         return LLIOC_STOP;
00811 }
00812 
00813 static int __init lloop_init(void)
00814 {
00815         int        i;
00816         unsigned int cmdlist[] = {
00817                 LL_IOC_LLOOP_ATTACH,
00818                 LL_IOC_LLOOP_DETACH_BYDEV,
00819         };
00820 
00821         if (max_loop < 1 || max_loop > 256) {
00822                 max_loop = MAX_LOOP_DEFAULT;
00823                 CWARN("lloop: invalid max_loop (must be between"
00824                       " 1 and 256), using default (%u)\n", max_loop);
00825         }
00826 
00827         lloop_major = register_blkdev(0, "lloop");
00828         if (lloop_major < 0)
00829                 return -EIO;
00830 
00831         CDEBUG(D_CONFIG, "registered lloop major %d with %u minors\n",
00832                lloop_major, max_loop);
00833 
00834         ll_iocontrol_magic = ll_iocontrol_register(lloop_ioctl, 2, cmdlist);
00835         if (ll_iocontrol_magic == NULL)
00836                 goto out_mem1;
00837 
00838         OBD_ALLOC_WAIT(loop_dev, max_loop * sizeof(*loop_dev));
00839         if (!loop_dev)
00840                 goto out_mem1;
00841 
00842         OBD_ALLOC_WAIT(disks, max_loop * sizeof(*disks));
00843         if (!disks)
00844                 goto out_mem2;
00845 
00846         for (i = 0; i < max_loop; i++) {
00847                 disks[i] = alloc_disk(1);
00848                 if (!disks[i])
00849                         goto out_mem3;
00850         }
00851 
00852         mutex_init(&lloop_mutex);
00853 
00854         for (i = 0; i < max_loop; i++) {
00855                 struct lloop_device *lo = &loop_dev[i];
00856                 struct gendisk *disk = disks[i];
00857 
00858                 lo->lo_queue = blk_alloc_queue(GFP_KERNEL);
00859                 if (!lo->lo_queue)
00860                         goto out_mem4;
00861 
00862                 mutex_init(&lo->lo_ctl_mutex);
00863                 sema_init(&lo->lo_sem, 0);
00864                 init_waitqueue_head(&lo->lo_bh_wait);
00865                 lo->lo_number = i;
00866                 spin_lock_init(&lo->lo_lock);
00867                 disk->major = lloop_major;
00868                 disk->first_minor = i;
00869                 disk->fops = &lo_fops;
00870                 sprintf(disk->disk_name, "lloop%d", i);
00871                 disk->private_data = lo;
00872                 disk->queue = lo->lo_queue;
00873         }
00874 
00875         /* We cannot fail after we call this, so another loop!*/
00876         for (i = 0; i < max_loop; i++)
00877                 add_disk(disks[i]);
00878         return 0;
00879 
00880 out_mem4:
00881         while (i--)
00882                 blk_cleanup_queue(loop_dev[i].lo_queue);
00883         i = max_loop;
00884 out_mem3:
00885         while (i--)
00886                 put_disk(disks[i]);
00887         OBD_FREE(disks, max_loop * sizeof(*disks));
00888 out_mem2:
00889         OBD_FREE(loop_dev, max_loop * sizeof(*loop_dev));
00890 out_mem1:
00891         unregister_blkdev(lloop_major, "lloop");
00892         ll_iocontrol_unregister(ll_iocontrol_magic);
00893         CERROR("lloop: ran out of memory\n");
00894         return -ENOMEM;
00895 }
00896 
00897 static void __exit lloop_exit(void)
00898 {
00899         int i;
00900 
00901         ll_iocontrol_unregister(ll_iocontrol_magic);
00902         for (i = 0; i < max_loop; i++) {
00903                 del_gendisk(disks[i]);
00904                 blk_cleanup_queue(loop_dev[i].lo_queue);
00905                 put_disk(disks[i]);
00906         }
00907         unregister_blkdev(lloop_major, "lloop");
00908 
00909         OBD_FREE(disks, max_loop * sizeof(*disks));
00910         OBD_FREE(loop_dev, max_loop * sizeof(*loop_dev));
00911 }
00912 
00913 module_param(max_loop, int, 0444);
00914 MODULE_PARM_DESC(max_loop, "maximum of lloop_device");
00915 MODULE_AUTHOR("OpenSFS, Inc. <http://www.lustre.org/>");
00916 MODULE_DESCRIPTION("Lustre virtual block device");
00917 MODULE_VERSION(LUSTRE_VERSION_STRING);
00918 MODULE_LICENSE("GPL");
00919 
00920 module_init(lloop_init);
00921 module_exit(lloop_exit);
